title: Re-installed Windows, Firewall issues.
body:
I have been trying all morning, with multiple fixes not working...
I'm running Windows 7 HP, on a Samsung NP300E4C...
I've run LoL on this PC before the Windows re-install many times...

The things I have try include...

Allowing certain things through my firewall...
Turning my firewall off...

Running LoL as administrator...

Going in the actual RIOT folder and enabling the Admin LoL.exe file in my fire wall...

Changing my DNS server to 8.8.8.8 and 8.8.4.4.

Multiple updates to Windows and Samsung (With my laptop being a Samsung).

Opening the LoL properties and changing compatibility to Windows 7.

I'm also currently running OCE Network Diagnostics, which says 10 minute wait, but has done nothing except say, "Testing connection to xxx.xxx.xxx.x/xx (IP Address) Game servers" for over half an hour now.

This is becoming quite the hassle. 

Please help me Rito...

replies.body:
Hi Space Cowboy,

At what point when trying to play do you see this issue?  Do you make it into game after champ select?

Mindstar

It was coming up with the firewall error right as Champ Select would continue into loading, screen staying black, and then the firewall error.
It ended up working, I sent in a Network Diagnostics report, re-installed LoL, and Removed Internet Explorer from my computer completely.

Hope this info helps for future reference.

Oh and thanks for your reply Mindstar.

> [{quoted}](name=Space Cowboy,realm=OCE,application-id=ElA0rvVL,discussion-id=uoWAJAVu,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2015-02-28T18:46:22.814+0000)
>
> It was coming up with the firewall error right as Champ Select would continue into loading, screen staying black, and then the firewall error.
> It ended up working, I sent in a Network Diagnostics report, re-installed LoL, and Removed Internet Explorer from my computer completely.
> 
> Hope this info helps for future reference.
> 
> Oh and thanks for your reply Mindstar.

No worries! Glad it is working for you now :)
Are you having an issue with patching, logging in or joining an active game?
